{"step_by_step_thinking": "Histamine is an organic nitrogenous compound involved in local immune responses and regulating physiological function in the gut. It also acts as a neurotransmitter. Histamine is stored in the granules of certain white blood cells, specifically mast cells and basophils, and is released as part of an immune response. Lymphocytes, neutrophils, and erythrocytes do not store histamine.", "answer_choice": "B. Mast cells"}
